subject: Horse Racing
lead_paragraph: The much-delayed return of the Belmont Stakes winner Rags to Riches has one more week to go. As expected, Rags to Riches, the first filly in 102 years to capture the Belmont States, will not run in tomorrow’s Ruffian Handicap at Belmont Park, but she is set for the one-and-an-eighth-mile Gazelle Stakes a week later. Rags to Riches, a 3-year-old filly, has won all five of her starts this year, and the Gazelle would be a final prep before the Breeders’ Cup Distaff at Monmouth Park on Oct. 27.
